Grooming gangs, free speech, Tommy Robinson: Musk has taken Britain’s ugliest domestic quarrels and broadcast them to the world, not because he loves Britain, but because chaos is his native language.

Nepal's interim govt: PM Karki unveils cabinet; Ghising made minister
description: Following violent demonstrations sparked by a social media ban and fueled by economic frustrations, Nepal's interim prime minister, Sushila Karki, has appointed her initial cabinet. The appointments aim to stabilize the nation and address demands for clean governance as Karki prepares to lead the country towards elections in March.

title: Former NBA Champion Andrew Bogut reveals: How Charlie Kirk's death impacted Australians
description: Andrew Bogut, the former NBA champion, has amplified the Australian reaction to Charlie Kirk's assassination. Bogut shared posts from Australian commentators highlighting concerns about public safety and freedom of speech following the incident at Utah Valley University. The posts also dissect the broader implications of Kirk's killing on public trust and political discourse.

title: New drama in handshake row: PCB lodges complaint; demands removal
description: The Pakistan Cricket Board has formally complained to the ICC regarding missing handshakes during the Asia Cup clash with India, demanding the removal of the Match Referee. The PCB alleges violations of the ICC Code of Conduct and MCC Laws, claiming the referee instructed their captain to avoid shaking hands.

We should keep AI ‘under our reins’ for the common good: Sitharaman
What India’s data engineering boom really looks like in 2025
description: India’s data engineering boom in 2025 is driving the backbone of the digital economy. With market size projected to exceed USD 42 billion, demand for skilled engineers outpaces supply, pushing salaries higher. Banking, e-commerce, and healthcare lead recruitment, while Python, cloud, and database expertise dominate the skills landscape. Attrition challenges persist, but opportunities remain transformative.

title: Karnataka HC dismisses BJP leader Pratap Simha’s plea against Dasara inauguration by Booker Prize winner Banu Mushtaq
ITR filing deadline today: How to file tax returns; step-by-step guide for taxpayers
description: ITR filing FY 2024-25: The Income Tax Department extended the ITR filing deadline or due date for AY 2025-26 to September 15, 2025. Filing after this date incurs penalties. The article provides a step-by-step guide for filing ITR-1 (Sahaj) through the income tax e-filing website.

BMW rams bike: Driver arrested; victim was taken to kin's hospital 22km away
description: Gaganpreet Kaur was arrested for allegedly driving the BMW that caused the death of finance ministry officer Navjot Singh in Dhaula Kuan. Singh's wife, Sandeep, injured in the crash, accused Kaur of delaying proper medical care, opting for a distant hospital linked to her relatives.

title: Asia Cup: India to be penalised for no handshakes? Here’s what the rules say
description: India's Asia Cup victory over Pakistan is now embroiled in controversy as the Indian team, led by Suryakumar Yadav, skipped the customary post-match handshake, citing directives from the government and BCCI. This action, potentially violating the ICC's Spirit of Cricket, drew criticism from Pakistan's coach, leading to a formal protest.

'I only regret she didn’t die in front of me': Gwalior murderer’s chilling confession
description: Arvind Parihar fatally shot his wife, Nandini Kewat, outside a stadium in Gwalior, showing no remorse and expressing relief from their constant arguments. The murder followed a complaint Nandini filed against him and his anger over a birthday video she posted with another man. Parihar, already married with children, accused Nandini of infidelity and financial exploitation before the deadly act.

title: Dhanush on the story behind his film Idli Kadai: ‘We didn’t have any money during our childhood to buy idlis…’

Oman property ownership for foreigners: Laws, rights, and requirements to know
description: Oman allows foreign nationals to own property under specific laws, primarily within Integrated Tourism Complexes (ITCs) and through regulated usufruct rights. This guide details the legal framework, eligibility, required documents, zones open to foreign buyers, and restrictions. It also outlines key risks, mortgage options, and recent policy updates aimed at attracting long-term investment while protecting national interests.

title: ‘Despite pleading, she purposely took us to a small hospital far away’: Wife of Finance Ministry officer killed in BMW accident to cops; driver arrested
‘Madam told me to go towards Azadpur — didn’t know she was driving BMW’: Van driver who took senior finance ministry official, wife to hospital
Small-town pivot: Tier-2 & 3 fuel India’s study abroad boom; state board students shine
description: India’s global education story is changing. For the first time, students from Tier 2 and 3 cities now make up over 57% of those studying abroad, up from 47% last year, according to UpGrad’s Transnational Education Report 2024–25. First-generation learners from State Boards are leading the charge, harnessing digital tools and sheer determination, rewriting a narrative once dominated by metro elites, while raising urgent questions about opportunities at home.

Same input, same output: Mira Murati on AI Standards; pushes for consistency
description: Thinking Labs, led by Mira Murati, is tackling nondeterminism in large language models, aiming for consistent outputs regardless of server load. Researchers believe current LLMs like ChatGPT and Gemini suffer from batch invariance issues, causing inconsistent answers. Their solution involves redesigning GPU kernels to ensure deterministic behavior, crucial for enterprise AI, scientific research, and model fine-tuning.

title: Heavy showers lash Pune since last night, Lohegaon receives most rainfall; water being released from 4 dams
Husband turns matchmaker: UP man marries off wife to her lover at temple
description: In Amethi, Shiv Shankar facilitated his wife Uma's marriage to her lover, Vishal, after discovering their ongoing affair despite their marriage in March. Unable to persuade Uma to end the relationship, Shiv Shankar arranged the wedding at Aditya Birla Temple, completing all rituals and personally bidding her farewell. The unusual event has sparked widespread discussion in the region.

title: Global science, Indian leadership: 10 years of gravitational-wave astronomy and India’s opportunity
Heavy rain, poor visibility hit Pune flights: Airlines issue advisories
description: Heavy rains and poor visibility caused significant disruptions at Pune airport, leading to the diversion of 14 flights and delays for several others between midnight and 8 am. Passengers faced considerable inconvenience as flights were rerouted to Ahmedabad and Mumbai, with some travelers stranded for hours.

Who are Bob Vylan? British punk-rap duo mocks Charlie Kirk’s assassination
description: British punk-rap duo Bob Vylan ignited controversy after Bobby Vylan seemingly mocked Charlie Kirk's assassination during an Amsterdam performance, making gun gestures and sniper jokes. This followed earlier backlash for chanting "Death to the IDF" at Glastonbury, causing visa issues. The incidents have sparked debates about free speech, artistic expression, and the potential for inciting political violence through performance.

description: RJD leader Tejashwi Yadav has strongly criticized PM Modi and CM Nitish Kumar, demanding action against Bihar minister Jibesh Mishra for allegedly assaulting a journalist who questioned road conditions. Yadav presented a video purportedly showing the incident and highlighted Mishra's alleged involvement in a fake drug case.

Apple iOS 26 release today: India release time; supported iPhone models and more
description: Apple is launching iOS 26 today, September 15th, at 10:30 PM IST, bringing a significant design overhaul and new features. The update introduces 'Liquid Glass,' Call Screening, Live Translation, and AutoMix. Compatible with iPhone 11 series and newer, iOS 26 enhances Messages, Apple Music, and CarPlay. Apple Intelligence features are exclusive to iPhone 15 Pro and later models.

title: Minor sisters dragged to jungle, gang-raped in Singrauli
description: In Singrauli district, two minor sisters, ages 16 and 17, were abducted and gang-raped in a jungle. The victims were discovered unconscious by police and locals after the horrific incident, which occurred while they were traveling to their aunt's village. Police have arrested three local residents in connection with the crime, and an investigation is ongoing.

Govt official killed as BMW hits bike; victim taken 22km away to hospital
description: Navjot Singh, a deputy secretary, died in a road accident, prompting questions about the delay in medical assistance. His son, Navnoor, revealed the couple's accident near Dhaula Kuan after visiting Gurdwara Bangla Sahib. Concerns arose as they were taken to a distant hospital, Nulife Hospital, while closer options like AIIMS and Safdarjung were available.

Woman poisoned, beaten to death over dowry in Uttar Pradesh; 5 booked
description: In Bithaura Kalan village, Kusma Devi, a 28-year-old woman, was allegedly poisoned and fatally bludgeoned due to dowry demands. Her husband, Chandra Pal, along with his parents, brother, and sister, are accused of demanding Rs 1 lakh, a motorbike, and a gold chain.

title: MP girl found dead on tracks; was under pressure to marry
description: Payal, a 24-year-old woman working near Mandideep, was found dead on railway tracks in Misrod, with police suspecting suicide. Family pressure regarding marriage proposals, against Payal's wishes, is being investigated as a potential factor.

title: ‘Where is the MLA?’: Bengaluru residents mark potholes in protest
description: Jayanagar residents are protesting unfinished "model road" projects promised two years ago by MLA CK Ramamurthy. Dug-up streets and broken footpaths have sparked resident action, including protests and pothole markings. While the South City Corporation assures allocated funds will be used for repairs, residents express frustration over delays and unresponsive officials.

title: Uttarakhand fire dept blunder: 900m sprint in 60 seconds with 65kg load required
description: Uttarakhand's recruitment rules for fire officers initially demanded an impossible feat: a 900m sprint with 65kg in 60 seconds. This unrealistic benchmark, faster than Olympic records, sparked online ridicule. The state government quickly acknowledged the error as a 'typo' and promised a revised, more reasonable assessment of fitness for applicants.

title: 'Not going to play': Patrick Mahomes injury blow revealed; what Andy Reid said
description: The Kansas City Chiefs will face the Philadelphia Eagles in Week 2 without rookie wide receiver Xavier Worthy due to a knee injury. Coach Andy Reid confirmed Worthy's absence, impacting the Chiefs' offensive strategy. Worthy's speed and deep-threat ability will be missed, placing more pressure on Travis Kelce and other receivers to perform against the Eagles' strong defense.
